body_content.explanation: a method of making an image appear three-dimensional (= having length, width, and depth) using two slightly different views of something that the brain combines into one image:
examples: The artist had a special interest in stereoscopy, and an ambivalent attitude towards perspective.
No camera lens can match the flexibility of the human eye and only a few experiments in stereoscopy attempt two-eyed (binocular) vision, essential to true 3-D perception.
